Reviews.Title: “Nice location, poor management”
Reviews.Author: Sara C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is strangely split into 2 buildings so if, like us, you are in the annex 2 doors down, you feel a bit detached from the hotel. The rooms are a good standard for the price and very clean. However, we asked for twin beds and were given 2 beds which were joined together so that we could not separate them and I therefore ended up on the couch! Breakfast was quite reasonable but no waiting staff present so impossible to ask for anything you needed. Our main gripe was the lack of hospitality - we arrived in Venice at 9pm and were checked in by the manager. The Hotel has a restaurant and we asked for a table but were told they were now closed. As many diners were still there and the advertised closing time is 9pm we were only minutes too late - I don't think this was a good start to our holiday! He could have offered at least something, and for this reason we did not return to eat there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sue J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a lovely little canal off the Grand Canal just one stop across from St Marks Square and is a lovely quiet spot. Breakfast was good quality, the room was small but we were in the annexe but was clean and we were only in it to sleep as there was just too much to see and do around Venice. The restaurant also served lunch and dinner which was of a good standard. Would definately stay here again just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “we won't be returning”
Reviews.Author: JimandJan
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Messner during a really freezing cold few days, our room was always warm, clean and tidy,the only good points really. The breakfast room was cold in the mornings, one afternoon we asked for coffee which seemed to be a chore for the employee as she wanted us to wait while she finished her hoovering, no interest seemed to be shown towards the guests, a few times we walked through the reception and no-one even spoke to us, other times with Italian hotels we have found people to be friendly and interested in what was going on, on reflection we see why this hotel has only two stars. We stayed in room 1; the room to be avoided! it is right above reception, we heard everyone coming and going and from around 6.30am reception staff could be heard talking and banging around, all in all a big disappointment on previous Italian trips. Hotel Messner needs to up its game!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal position for good price”
Reviews.Author: Dombrik81
Reviews.Content: Very good location for the price offered. Pleasant stuff, free WiFi access (unless stated 2E/hour). The walls design in the room is quite impressive and looks like stylish 19-th century one :) WiFi hardly accessible from corner room. No signs of the Hotel in the near streets, only one outside of the entrance on the building - the coordinates from booking.com were useful for our navigator.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Messner and good value also”
Reviews.Author: love78
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in our search for a last-minute room in Venice. The hotel is conveniently located five minutes walking from La Salute church, where there is also the boat stop. We arrived directly from the train station (line 1). We realized that there is a three stars hotel in the main building, while the cheaper rooms are located in a near structure. Room was ok, overlooking a garden. It was silent and extremely clean. Heating was ok as well. Bathroom was tiny, but water was hot and good towels were provided. We couldn't make the TV work though. Breakfast is served in the restaurant in the main building. There was a good selection of pastries, fruit, jogurt, teas etc.. The staff was kind and extremely helpful, we had an enjoable stay at Messner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room in the main building at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Wilhelmina87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Messner for 4 night in early October 2011. In fact, I was pleasantly surprised with the room, which was on the 1st floor of their main buildings. The room overlooked the canal and had 3 windows with shutters and a small balcony facing the canal. The room was clean, neat, and well kept. The bathroom was small, but had everything in it. The restaurant was o.k., but sometimes when it was busy service was rather slow. The people at the reception were as helpful as they could be considering their limited English. The only thing I am not happy about is the inadequate response to my inquiries regarding items I accidently left in a drawer in the room. I inquired twice by phone and on the receptionist's suggestion send the hotel one inquiry by e-mail. However, a week after my initial inquiry, I still have not been able to find out whether my property was found.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: OverworkedMom48
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hotel Messner for 10 days and found it delightful. I had a beautiful corner room overlooking the Rio Fornace and looked forward to 'coming home' at night. The staff was very accomodating, helpful, kind, and friendly--they never turned down any of my requests for assistance, and in fact, went out of their way to be of service. The location is great, just behind Salute and across the Grand Canal from San Marco. I would happily send any of my friends there.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good deal”
Reviews.Author: Avi I
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during the mask carnival. Room was specious and clean, so the bathroom. Breakfast was OK, they have also good restaurant. The Location is pretty good - close to the canal - and one boat stop from S. Marco. Although the hotel was rated as 2 star - in my opinion it was better than most of 3 star hotels that I visited in Europe. They have one more building, I stayed at the one with the reception and the restaurant, so, I canâ€™t tell about the other.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price! Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: lindajane0321
Reviews.Content: Disagree with previous reviews, we stayed in the annex and it wad fine, clean, Maid came into room each day, left clean large bath towels. We paid Â£368 for 5 nights for two of us (including flights)with Travel Republic, so Â£200 for the room which was excellent. Few mins walk from Salute Vapoetto stop, 5 mins walk to Acadamia bridge from where you can walk to San Marco square, the Zattare and Grand Canal at either end of the street. Hotel staff friendly and helpful, breakfast good, coffee and croissants were nice. We had set meal 15 euros each and wine 10 euros in the restaurant, it was our best night. I would highly recommend and would stay again. Go to Burano for a great day out.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at Hotel Messner”
Reviews.Author: sos90
Reviews.Content: The room was $160 a night and was not worth it except for the location. The room was infested with mosquitos and was not clean. The bathroom was tiny, and had to ask for towels. The room was also dark and dreary in the annex. The main problem with the hotel was the staff. They were unfriendly and went out of there way to be rude/sarcastic. The location was good because it was in walking distance to a local market and restaurants. Don't waste your money at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the annex”
Reviews.Author: Wirralian
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Salute vaporetto stop and therefore St Marks. Very welcoming and helpful manager and public areas OK for this grade of hotel. I've read elsewhere that the rooms in the main building are fine but we were given a room in the annex which was grim and should be avoided at almost any price.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WorldWineTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the annex and the room was tiny and cramped. The hallway was dirty and stinky. The annex smelled like a dirty locker room. The mosquitoes ate us alive in the room in October. I can not imagine what they would be like in warmer months. The staff was curt and short with our requests for help. Venice is beautiful but this hotel was a real drag on our otherwise enjoyable time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: easrq71
Reviews.Content: We were with an Elderhostel group of 32. More than half of the group shared a room. The location was excellent in the Dorsoduro sesteri, very near the Salute vaporretto stop, between the Grand Canal and the Giudecca Canal. There was a nice, fairly large grocery some walk along the Guidecca Canal. Our group had most of our meals at the hotel restaurant. They were ok but imagine if you could order off the menu they would be better. Breakfast was the usual cold buffet. There were rooms in the hotel and in a couple of annexes. We had room 37 on the first floor. According to some in our group ours was pretty good. We had 2 twins pushed together and an extra bed in the room.The sheets, towels etc. were changed every day. But bugs that we killed on the floor stayed there. The shower in the bathroom was surrounded by a folding door. It was of adequate size for me but even an average man would have difficulty even turning around in it. We did have hot water Others did not. Our toilet ran. The floor tiles in the bathroom were cracked. As ithe roomn was pre-paid I do not know the cost. But it was the absolute worst hotel I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Charming friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: NorthernVAShelly
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Messner. We originally booked it because of the value and proximity to San Marco (only 1 vaporetto stop away) but really enjoyed our stay there. The room was fine with an en suite bath and a view of the garden. The breakfast was hearty and the one dinner we had in the restaurant was great - best gnocchi and sage I've had. The real plus was the staff - the manager played concierge for us and gave great tips. My husband is an early riser and was up each day before us and before breakfast so the staff would make him cappucino and seat him in the garden. They even took photos of the hotel cat (orange tabby) sitting in his lap. My husband would also tire of shopping and go back to the garden to chill with a glass of wine before changing for dinner. The Dorsoduro neighborhood is very nice and not at all crowded with great shops and cafes. It is a very central location within an easy walk/vaporetto stop or bridge crossing to anywhere in Venice. All in all it was a great location and experience at an affordable price - in the world's oldest tourist city - can you ask for more?

Reviews.Title: “An OK Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kimokini
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Messner in Venice for 2 nights from 10/6/08 â€“ 10/8/08. To sum it upâ€¦ we got what we paid for. We bought our stay through hotels.com for $168 a night with all fees and taxes. Thatâ€™s a cheaper hotel in Venice. Be careful most hotels donâ€™t have a private bathroom. This hotel offered both options. Our room was with a private bathroom. What we liked: â€¢Close to water bus stop. Only one bridge to cross with luggage â€¢Breakfast included in price. â€¢Clean enough â€¢Close to Accademia Bridge which takes you over to the side with San Marco â€¢Decent size room for Europe (didnâ€™t feel cramped) â€¢Hairdryer in room but was a bit of a pain. â€¢Friendly/Helpful staff that spoke pretty good English. â€¢Extra pillows in the cabinet â€¢Close to Nicoâ€™s Gelateria What we didnâ€™t like: â€¢Small room for US â€¢Smelled like smoke even though it was a non-smoking room. â€¢Double rooms are two beds pushed together to make one bigger bed. â€¢Uncomfortable beds. Had springs popping out the top. â€¢No Lift â€¢TV was very small. Only English channel was MTV â€¢Old â€¢Very small stall shower â€¢Doors close at 1am so be back by then. â€¢No hangers â€¢Internet was only available for a fee. â€¢Our room window opened to the courtyard so the noise of some people woke us in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Worldfrog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Messner with my wife and two children (5 and 7). Overall, I think that for the price, you will be hard pressed to find a better place to stay. The hotel is a little difficult to find, but is actually only about five minutes walk or so from the vaporetto stop. We were able to book a quadruple, which is definitely a plus with small children, and even though the hotel is only one stop away from the Basilica San Marco and all the tourist crowds that entails, the hotel itself is in a nice quiet area - we were able to leave our windows open for long periods without hearing any loud noises outside. Breakfast was included in our rate, and was an "all you can eat" buffet style, which included cereals, juices, coffee, pastries, and the like. While the breakfast probably wasn't as good as you might have been able to find in a shop, it was decent, and I have no complaints. The room was comfortable and reasonably sized, and clean. The proprietor was friendly and helpful throughout our stay. There is also a restaurant attached, however, I wouldn't recommend eating there, as you can definitely find better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ahh Messner”
Reviews.Author: LisbethBelle
Reviews.Content: Messner is not a particularly stylish hotel, nor is it an example of the opulence and grandeur many tourists may come to Venice in the hope of experiencing. The decor is dated (eg. tacky Murano glass chandeliers), but it is not terrible. Rooms are not luxuriously furnished, but are comfortable. My fiance and I shared a room with a double bed framed by wooden wardrobes and cupboards set into the wall (plenty of storage!), a good-sized bathroom with a shower and, notably, a shiny new-looking TV with Italian Sky, which showed CNN and BBC News amongst other channels. In a priced-up city full of rip-offs, this hotel is good value. You get what you pay for, and you're actually setting up your base in a fantastic area of Venice. Two minutes walk away is the Peggy Guggenheim gallery and the beautiful, enormous Salute church. At the same distance is the vaporetto stop, and it takes less than 5 minutes on the vap. to cross the Grand Canal to St Mark's Square. This is one of the huge advantages of this hotel - you are so close to the best sights of the city, but you are not paying the extortionate prices of St Mark's. One word of warning - do not eat supper at the hotel restaurant. Our experience of it was unpleasant and we would not recommend it. Food in Venice is not, from experience, on a par with that in Rome or Florence, and you will find that the old saying "I could buy a better pizza at home" applies here. However, if you're into your seafood you will find plenty of other places to eat out. We recommend that you eat wisely and explore a little, rather than eat in the sestier of San Marco where everything is doubly expensive. All in all, it's great if you're willing to sacrifice luxury for convenience, location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Outside the area of Galloping Tourist Hordes”
Reviews.Author: bacchusman4
Reviews.Content: 2*, 120E/nite for two, including breakfast. Stayed here 7/20-7/21. Located in Dorsoduro, Salute stop on Route 1 to St. Markâ€™s. Very short walk after getting off the water bus. One of the quieter parts of Venice. Small rooms, but air conditioned. This hotel has two parts, with an annex (where prices are a bit lower) in a separate building across the street from the main hotel. Decent bkfsts with lots of fresh fruit available but coffee is 2nd rate. Breakfast can be taken in a nice patio area outside. Generally friendly staff, but variable. Wi-fi internet 5E/hr. Relationship between price and room quality would be negative most other places, but this is Venice and I've stayed here before.

Reviews.Title: “Self Service Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcusandgriffin
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Messner for one night. Other reviewers & guidebooks have said that the service is great but that was not our experience. We booked a junior suite with two beds over the phone for 150E When we arrived, there was a mix-up and we were shown a small, dingy, dark single room with 1 bed (not sure what the cost of this type of room would be - not worth more than 70E in the very highest season). The man working reception did not offer to help us carry our bags up or down the stairs. We did get the suite in the end and it was a nice large room overlooking a canal. The shower was teeny though and would be impossible for anyone who is a bit larger to get into. The two beds were made up as one matrimonial bed (common in Italy) and we asked for new sheets so we could split the bed. The man said he would send the maid. When we returned 6 hours later, the beds had not been changed. I called reception and the man told me he forgot & to come to the main building two doors down to get the sheets (which I did). Breakfast the next morning consisted of pre-packaged melba toasts, cheese food, bad coffee, etc. The other guests all seemed to be a school group.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian treasure”
Reviews.Author: lizchick
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Messner for three nights right around Carnivale, Venice's annual masked festival. While I agree with previous reviewers about the groups of students (we booked the hotel because of my boyfriend's previous stay there as part of a student group, and we also walked in one morning to find the lobby packed with French schoolchildren, who we had the pleasure of hearing running through the halls later that night), the overall quality of the hotel in relation to the price isn't easy to find in Venice. Hotel Messner is located in Dorsoduro, which is a little out of the main tourist area of the city, but still lovely with plenty of attractions nearby and an amazing stroll to St. Mark's (about 15-20 mins). Our room actually looked directly out onto a canal, with the top of the beautiful Santa Maria della Salute church just visible. Everything was very clean (including the bathroom, and I'm picky about that!), and we found the staff very kind and helpful-- ready to give suggestions about where to eat or what to see in Venice, as well as just to chat. We stayed in the main part of the hotel, and especially by Italian standards the room was relatively spacious. As for the noise, I had friends who stayed in hotels in other areas in Venice and complained about the outside noise from people in the streets. We at least were able to ask the kids to quiet down, and they listened. If noise is an issue though, you might want to ask specifically for a quiet room away from any school groups.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hk1303
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Messner could not have been more helpful or friendly. When we arrived the room in our original hotel was not available and we were sent here. There are 3 parts to the hotel we saw them all! 2 Star - perfectly aduequate for a 2 star room. Clean, average size, get what you pay for. 3 Star - These are the junior suites on a small canal and this is where we stayed for 3 nights. Very roomy with 3 tall windows opening out onto the canal - beautiful! We would definately choose these rooms if we stayed here again - well worth the extra money. 1 star - We stayed 1 night here and it's fine for a budget room. Probably be a bit hot in the summer with no air con. Breakfast - Continental - fresh bread, juices, cheeses, meats, fruit, cereals, honey, jams, choccie spread!, cakes etc etc. A large fresh choice whatever time you take breakfast. Really good. Location - Fantastic...5-10 mins walk from Accademia Bridge (near St Marks Square). Away from the tourist masses and situated on a small canal with waterside restaurants and cafes just minutes away. Towels - Yes...the hand towels are like cloths! However they also provided large bath towels. This would be our first choice if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kim2
Reviews.Content: Was I at the same place as the previous reviewers?? We had a junior suite which was roomy, quiet, clean, and romantic. I think the travelers with the complaints may have stayed in the annex rooms which are 1 star, compared to the junior suites which are three star. The hotel is in three parts: main house (I didn't see these rooms so I can not comment), the junior suites, and the annex. The annex rooms are actually the two or three floors of rooms above the junior suites. During our stay there was a group of German students over us and we never heard a peep. The staff were helpful and the restaurant was very nice. Breakfast was very satisfying. I would be happy to return to this hotel again and can well recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “High priced, noisy, and very small - skip this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel experience was the worst of our three week vacation in Europe. It was populated mainly by university age students who were loud and obnoxious. Hence we didn't sleep much and our complaints to the front desk went unnoticed. The first morning there was no hot water for shower or shaving. The front desk said they had plumbing problems and it would be fixed soon. It wasn't fixed till late afternoon. The walls are paper thin and if you are next to the common washroom (we had an ensuite) the door will bang all night. There is no elevator and we were on the third floor which is accessed by long narrow stairs and hallways. I'm not sure of the building standards in Venice but doubt very much that many would be able to escape safely if there was a fire. The room is very small and the price is very high for what you get. It made our visit to Venice one that we won't forget...and would highly recommend that you steer clear of this hotel. The front desk seemed to be pleasant on our arrival but could care less when we complained about the noise and interruptions. On Saturday night the students settled down sometime after 3 am but were up at it at 7 am. I'm not sure if there was a teacher or chaparone in charge. There were other students from the U.S who were also staying at the hotel but they were well behaved, quiet and considerate. Our end of the building contained the German students who were literally just out to party. Perhaps the hotel management was afraid of losing so much student business that they tolerated the noise and rude and incosiderate guests as there were so few of us 'others'. In any event it was a terrible experience and the old saying that 'cheap is expensive' rang true. We didn't sleep a wink. Room is exceptionally small but we could have over looked this for cleanliness and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, checked out early!”
Reviews.Author: guptaup
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here only 1 night b/c we found another hotel to stay at. The room was the smallest we stayed in (even by European standards). We had already stayed in Rome and Florence but this was a surprise to see how small the room was. There was no elevator, and 2 long flights of stairs and hallways to get to our room. The staff was nice though, but I would not recommend this hotel since there are many better ones to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in Hotel Messner. We had a wonderful room overlooking a garden. It was quiet, modern, very comfortable. The breakfast was great and the staff was friendly. And you can't beat the location! You could practically see the gorgeous white church Santa Maria della Salute from the hotel. Our experience would definitely lead us to return here if we are in Venice again! One tip - the towels were totally inadequate, just pieces of cloth, so you might want to bring your own!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Messner
HotelInfo.Address: Dorsoduro 216 | Fondamenta Ca' BalÃ , 30123 Venice, Italy
